headline: Potato Soup with Hash Browns
description: This hearty, warming potato soup with hash browns is garnished with bacon bits, Cheddar, and green onions for that classic baked potato taste.
name: Potato Soup with Hash Browns
recipeIngredient: 1 (28 ounce) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
0.33333334326744 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste
2 tablespoons bacon bits, or to taste
2 tablespoons sliced green onions, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Put hash browns, chicken broth, soup, potato, onion, and pepper in a slow cooker.
Cover and cook on Low until diced potatoes are tender and soup is hot, 3 to 5 hours.
Drop in softened cream cheese; use a whisk to get it all melted and mixed in.
Garnish with Cheddar cheese, bacon bits, and green onions.

review.reviewBody: This is a go too. Currently in crockpot right now for dinner tonight. Only thing I have changed over the years is: add second can of cream of chicken reduce sodium and I use chicken bouillon then add water. Garnish with Chedder Cheese, Sour Cream, more bacon pieces and green onions. Yummy
Added extra cheese and it’s GREAT!! I’ve made it at least 10 times. I also mash up the hash browns to thicken it.

Made this exactly as recipe stated. It was good but a little bland. I’d recommend using an immersion blender to blend the hash browns and make the soup creamy, otherwise the potato texture is stringy. It really needs the bacon, cheese and green onions on top to complete it. I think it also could be a good base for a cheddar cheese soup which I think I will try next time.
